intro: Carex oligostachys, commonly known as the narrowleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its triangular stems and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, typically found in dense clusters at the tips of the stems. Carex oligostachys thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands, marshes, and along stream banks. Its ecological importance includes providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
